text:
March 4
1969
Mr. John W. Macy, Jr., President
Corporation for Public Broadcasting
1250 Connecticut Avenue, N.W., Suite 630
Washington, D.C. 20036
Dear Mr. Macy:
This note is to express appreciation to you and to the Corporation
for Public Broadcasting for an outstanding contribution to the success
of last week's annual Western Radio-Television Association convention
in Seattle.
Consultant Donald Quayle delivered two brilliant presentations at
the meetings. One, “Radio and the CPB," was primarily for the radio
members present. The other, “The Public Broadcasting Corporation," was
a general session with the several hundred registrants in attendance.
Audience reaction was enthusiastic in both instances.
In addition, Don was available for individual and small group
conferences through his entire stay in Seattle.
In writing this note, I know that I reflect the views of all
those in attendance at WRTA when I reiterate our thanks to the CPB.
Sincerely,
Ken Kager
Radio Member
WRTA Planning Committee
